DOC.brief_summary: Study is to compare antifungal prophylaxis of Voriconazole and Itraconazole in subjects who have had a Stem Cell Transplant. The success of the end point will be measured using evidence of Infection, drug compliance and survival.
DOC.brief_title: Voriconazole Versus Itraconazole In Primary Prophylaxis Of Invasive Fungal Infection (IFI) In Subjects With Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplants (HSCT)
DOC.criteria: Allogeneic HSCT for acute leukemia (AML, ALL or myelodysplastic syndrome) failed lymphoma therapy or transformation of CML Male and Female over 12 years or greater Possible, probable or proven IFI at study entry or at any time in 6 months prior to study entry, defined according to the 'consensus criteria' (Ascioglu et al 2002) Previous history of zygomycosis Anticipated survival less than one month
